p: The maximum likelihood phylogenetic reconstruction of the obtained MAYV genome and a few other available MAYV genomes showed that the Sinop strain clustered within the L genotype and was closely related to the MAYV strains detected from mosquitoes in the 1960s in Par√° state (PA) in the northern region of Brazil ( Figure 2a,b), showing a high aLRT SH-like support of 1.0. Meanwhile, the CHIKV genome was placed in a polytomy within a previously described Brazilian subclade that is an offshoot of the East/Central/South African lineage [ 21], which also had a high aLRT SH-like support of 1.0 ( Figure 3a). Interestingly, the CHIKV sequenced here did not cluster with other lineages from the state of Mato Grosso ( Figure 3b).
